meanings.definition: To perform (a role or piece of music) with restraint or subtlety.
meanings.sent1: She underplayed her emotions in the play, showing them subtly.
meanings.sent2: He underplayed the piano piece, making it sound gentle and delicate.
meanings.sent3: The actor underplayed the scene so much that the audience thought it was a comedy!
meanings.sent4: Her performance underplayed the complexity of the character, leaving the audience intrigued.
meanings.sent5: The musician underplayed the notes, creating a sense of mystery in the melody.

meanings.definition: To present (something) as being less important or serious than it actually is.
meanings.sent1: The news anchor underplayed the severity of the storm, causing confusion.
meanings.sent2: She underplayed the significance of the event, downplaying its impact.
meanings.sent3: His attempt to underplay the situation only made it more obvious.
meanings.sent4: The politician underplayed the issue, hoping it would fade away unnoticed.
meanings.sent5: By underplaying the problem, she unintentionally made it seem trivial.
